node.title: Cricket Australia admits it should have disclosed Paine investigation
node.alt: Side-on view of Tim Paine wiping his eye at press conference.
node.description: Cricket Australia's current leadership team says the organisation madeÂ a mistake by not revealing in 2018 it was investigating Time Paine's role in a text-messaging incident with a woman, which has led to his resignation as men's Test captain.
node.content: ["Cricket Australia (CA) says the organisation made the wrong decision in 2018 not to reveal it was investigating\u00a0the Tim Paine text-messaging incident, which has led to his resignation as men's Test captain.", "Paine announced on Friday he was stepping down from the role, having disclosed he was involved in a sexting scandal with a female former employee of Cricket Tasmania\u00a0in late 2017.", "He was cleared by CA following its investigation in 2018.", "CA chair\u00a0Richard Freudenstein,\u00a0who did not hold that position in 2018,\u00a0spoke to the media on Saturday afternoon, saying the organisation should have spoken publicly about the investigation at the time.", "\"While I cannot speak about the original decision making in 2018 \u2026\u00a0I can say if Cricket Australia was faced with the same circumstances, with the relevant information about all of this matter, Cricket Australia would not make the same decisions today,\" he said.", "More to come."]
